bioghist.p: Cuthbert Collingwood Gordon (1807-1884) was born in Salem, New Hampshire and ordained as a Universalist minister in Stafford, Conn in 1837. He served in churches in Vernon and Nunda, NY and in South Danvers, MA.

In 1860, at the age of 53, he retired from the ministry for health reasons, making Brooklyn, NY his home until his death. After retirement he served as secretary of the Architectural Iron Works and briefly as president of the Philadelphia Car Company. He continued his correspondence with ministers and Society members into his 70s.
bioghist.head: Biography/History

scopecontent.p: Correspondence of Universalist minister, Cuthbert Collingwood Gordon. The letters span 1850-1883. The bulk of the collection consists of letters from Universalist ministers and Universalist Society members in New York State and New England.

Correspondents include C. C. Gordon's wife, Harriet, and Daniel (Delta) Batchelor, Utica, NY. Also included are 55 letters (1878-1883) from C. C. Gordon, Brooklyn, NY to Batchelor, including the last from C. C. Gordon in his own hand (08/09/1883) and the last from C. C. Gordon dictated to and transcribed by his son, C. O. Gordon (10/24/1883) and one letter from C. C. Gordon to Harriet (1863).
